page.title: 19Sharnbrook's Farms
page.content: The{'three field' system}of farming used in the Middle Ages remained in Sharnbrook till the{Enclosures}of 1820. The hedges have gone again to open up the small fields so the farmers can use their huge machines. Low lying meadows near the river and brook are used for{fattening beef {cattle,}while the rough grazing around the village is used for{sheep}or horses - the latter kept for recreational purposes. On the heavier, higher land{grain {crops}are grown;{oil seed rape}is a recently introduced break crop. One farmer keeps{pigs}on an intensive system, as well as rearing{turkeys}for the traditional Christmas dinner. The farms are highly mechanised and very few people are employed on the land. There is one{market garden producing salad crops.
